subject: Critical Thinking
title: The Asymmetry of Ruin: Why Not Losing Beats Winning
description: A 60-second lesson on The Asymmetry of Ruin: Why Not Losing Beats Winning.

hook.text: If you lose 50% of your money, you need a 100% gain to break even. Losses and gains are not symmetrical.

buildup.text: The asymmetry of ruin: a single catastrophic loss can destroy what thousands of small wins built.

discovery.text: Warren Buffett's Rule #1: 'Never lose money.' Rule #2: 'Never forget Rule #1.' Preservation beats maximization.

twist.text: This applies beyond finance: reputation, health, and trust all share this asymmetry. Hard to build, easy to destroy.

climax.text: The Kelly Criterion: even with positive expected value, you should never bet everything.

punchline.text: The first rule of winning: don't get wiped out.

quiz.question: Why is a 50% loss harder to recover from than a 50% gain is to achieve?
